content_modification_operations.description: This function appears to perform key generation and key export operations using the CryptoAPI, which indicates it is involved in cryptographic processes.
This function is allocating memory from the heap, not performing encryption operations.
This function appears to be identifying logical drives and possibly processing them, but there is no indication of encryption operations.
The function appears to perform content encryption or modification using CryptGenRandom and CryptEncrypt, which indicates potential encryption.
The function appears to engage in Salsa20 encryption, a known stream cipher, by setting up an appropriate state with input values and performing cryptographic operations on them.
The function performs a Base64 encoding of the input data, which is not an encryption algorithm.
This function involves operations typically associated with Base64 encoding/decoding and potentially modifying data from memory.
Function frees allocated memory if the pointer is not null.
The function appears to perform cryptographic operations by importing a cryptographic key using the CryptImportKey function. This suggests it is part of an encryption or decryption mechanism.
The function appears to perform multiple bitwise rotations and XOR operations in rounds resembling the structure of a block cipher, suggesting that it is an encryption function.
